snippet: Mr. Bush, starting to assert his own political identity for a possible 2016 bid, made it clear he did not want to be judged on his brother’s presidency.
abstract: Jeb Bush, addressing Chicago Council on Global Affairs, attempts to distance himself from his brother George's presidency even as he shares a vision of a strong and assertive role for America in world events that is reminiscent of his brother's foreign policy strategies; Bush knows he must develop his own political identity if he is to succeed in the Republican presidential primary and go on to carry general-election votes.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Bush, starting to assert his own political identity for a possible 2016 bid, made it clear he did not want to be judged on his brother’s presidency.

headline.main: Jeb Bush Tries to Distance Himself From Brother in Foreign Affairs Speech
headline.print_headline: ‘I Am My Own Man,’ Bush Says in Chicago Foreign Affairs Speech
